gita: Gita (6.5): Uddharet Atmanam — Lift yourself by your Self.
thought: Dukh ka arth hai—naya uday hone wala hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Close your eyes. Place your right hand over your heart. Breathe in gently. Say: 'Main hoon. Main kaafi hoon.' Stay with the warmth for a few moments.

gita: Gita (3.8): Karmaṇy evādhikāras te — Action is better than inaction.
thought: Energy follows action. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Stand up gently. Raise both arms over your head and inhale deeply. Stretch. Exhale while whispering: 'Chalu kar diya.' Now begin one small task.

gita: Gita (6.6): Bandhur ātmā — The mind can be a friend or enemy.
thought: Jo chinta karta hai, wo jeevan ka samay barbad karta hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Rub your palms. Touch your forehead with warmth. Whisper softly: 'Mujhe apne man par vishwas hai.' Now let one thought dissolve with each exhale.

gita: Gita (2.63): Krodhat bhavati sammohah — Anger leads to delusion.
thought: Anger is like fire; the more you feed it, the more it burns you.
whisper: Main shant hoon, main samajhdar hoon.
practice: Breathe in for 4 counts, hold for 4, exhale for 4. Repeat three times. Place a cool palm on your neck and feel calm return.

gita: Gita (2.60): Indriyani pramathini — Senses drag the mind easily.
thought: Jahaan dhyan hai, wahi jeevan hai.
whisper: Mera man mere paas vaapas aa raha hai.
practice: Put your phone away. Sit quietly and focus on the sound of your breath for 30 seconds. Whisper: 'Main vapas yahan hoon.'

gita: Gita (18.66): Sarva-dharmān parityajya — Surrender to Me, I’ll protect you.
thought: You are not a drop in the ocean; you are the ocean in a drop. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Look into a mirror (or palm). Smile. Say gently: 'Tu khaas hai.' Let the words soak into your being like sunlight.

gita: Gita (4.7): Whenever there is decline in dharma, I manifest Myself.
thought: Tumhara astitva kisi aur se chhota nahi hai.
practice: Place both hands on your shoulders. Give yourself a light hug. Whisper: 'Main mujhme poori hoon.' Stay there for 10 seconds.

gita: Gita (6.26): Wherever the mind wanders, bring it back to the Self.
thought: Vichaaron ka bazaar band karo, mann ka mandir kholo.
practice: Sit cross-legged. Breathe slowly. With each inhale, say 'Sa'; with each exhale, say 'Ham'. Repeat 5 times.

whisper: Main shant hoon, main samajhdar hoon.
practice: Breathe in for 4 counts, hold for 4, exhale for 4. Repeat three times. Place a cool palm on your neck and feel calm return.

gita: Gita (2.60): Indriyani pramathini — Senses drag the mind easily.
thought: Jahaan dhyan hai, wahi jeevan hai.
whisper: Mera man mere paas vaapas aa raha hai.
practice: Put your phone away. Sit quietly and focus on the sound of your breath for 30 seconds. Whisper: 'Main vapas yahan hoon.'

gita: Gita (18.66): Sarva-dharmān parityajya — Surrender to Me, I’ll protect you.
thought: You are not a drop in the ocean; you are the ocean in a drop. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Look into a mirror (or palm). Smile. Say gently: 'Tu khaas hai.' Let the words soak into your being like sunlight.

gita: Gita (4.7): Whenever there is decline in dharma, I manifest Myself.
thought: Tumhara astitva kisi aur se chhota nahi hai.
practice: Place both hands on your shoulders. Give yourself a light hug. Whisper: 'Main mujhme poori hoon.' Stay there for 10 seconds.

gita: Gita (6.26): Wherever the mind wanders, bring it back to the Self.
thought: Vichaaron ka bazaar band karo, mann ka mandir kholo.
practice: Sit cross-legged. Breathe slowly. With each inhale, say 'Sa'; with each exhale, say 'Ham'. Repeat 5 times.

gita: Gita (6.5): Uddharet Atmanam — Lift yourself by your Self.
thought: Dukh ka arth hai—naya uday hone wala hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Close your eyes. Place your right hand over your heart. Breathe in gently. Say: 'Main hoon. Main kaafi hoon.' Stay with the warmth for a few moments.

gita: Gita (3.8): Karmaṇy evādhikāras te — Action is better than inaction.
thought: Energy follows action. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Stand up gently. Raise both arms over your head and inhale deeply. Stretch. Exhale while whispering: 'Chalu kar diya.' Now begin one small task.

gita: Gita (6.6): Bandhur ātmā — The mind can be a friend or enemy.
thought: Jo chinta karta hai, wo jeevan ka samay barbad karta hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Rub your palms. Touch your forehead with warmth. Whisper softly: 'Mujhe apne man par vishwas hai.' Now let one thought dissolve with each exhale.

practice: Place both hands on your shoulders. Give yourself a light hug. Whisper: 'Main mujhme poori hoon.' Stay there for 10 seconds.

gita: Gita (6.26): Wherever the mind wanders, bring it back to the Self.
thought: Vichaaron ka bazaar band karo, mann ka mandir kholo.
practice: Sit cross-legged. Breathe slowly. With each inhale, say 'Sa'; with each exhale, say 'Ham'. Repeat 5 times.

gita: Gita (6.5): Uddharet Atmanam — Lift yourself by your Self.
thought: Dukh ka arth hai—naya uday hone wala hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Close your eyes. Place your right hand over your heart. Breathe in gently. Say: 'Main hoon. Main kaafi hoon.' Stay with the warmth for a few moments.

gita: Gita (3.8): Karmaṇy evādhikāras te — Action is better than inaction.
thought: Energy follows action. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Stand up gently. Raise both arms over your head and inhale deeply. Stretch. Exhale while whispering: 'Chalu kar diya.' Now begin one small task.

gita: Gita (6.6): Bandhur ātmā — The mind can be a friend or enemy.
thought: Jo chinta karta hai, wo jeevan ka samay barbad karta hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Rub your palms. Touch your forehead with warmth. Whisper softly: 'Mujhe apne man par vishwas hai.' Now let one thought dissolve with each exhale.

gita: Gita (2.63): Krodhat bhavati sammohah — Anger leads to delusion.
thought: Anger is like fire; the more you feed it, the more it burns you.
whisper: Main shant hoon, main samajhdar hoon.
practice: Breathe in for 4 counts, hold for 4, exhale for 4. Repeat three times. Place a cool palm on your neck and feel calm return.

gita: Gita (2.60): Indriyani pramathini — Senses drag the mind easily.
thought: Jahaan dhyan hai, wahi jeevan hai.
whisper: Mera man mere paas vaapas aa raha hai.
practice: Put your phone away. Sit quietly and focus on the sound of your breath for 30 seconds. Whisper: 'Main vapas yahan hoon.'

gita: Gita (18.66): Sarva-dharmān parityajya — Surrender to Me, I’ll protect you.
thought: You are not a drop in the ocean; you are the ocean in a drop. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Look into a mirror (or palm). Smile. Say gently: 'Tu khaas hai.' Let the words soak into your being like sunlight.

practice: Stand up gently. Raise both arms over your head and inhale deeply. Stretch. Exhale while whispering: 'Chalu kar diya.' Now begin one small task.

gita: Gita (6.6): Bandhur ātmā — The mind can be a friend or enemy.
thought: Jo chinta karta hai, wo jeevan ka samay barbad karta hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Rub your palms. Touch your forehead with warmth. Whisper softly: 'Mujhe apne man par vishwas hai.' Now let one thought dissolve with each exhale.

gita: Gita (2.63): Krodhat bhavati sammohah — Anger leads to delusion.
thought: Anger is like fire; the more you feed it, the more it burns you.
whisper: Main shant hoon, main samajhdar hoon.
practice: Breathe in for 4 counts, hold for 4, exhale for 4. Repeat three times. Place a cool palm on your neck and feel calm return.

gita: Gita (2.60): Indriyani pramathini — Senses drag the mind easily.
thought: Jahaan dhyan hai, wahi jeevan hai.
whisper: Mera man mere paas vaapas aa raha hai.
practice: Put your phone away. Sit quietly and focus on the sound of your breath for 30 seconds. Whisper: 'Main vapas yahan hoon.'

gita: Gita (18.66): Sarva-dharmān parityajya — Surrender to Me, I’ll protect you.
thought: You are not a drop in the ocean; you are the ocean in a drop. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Look into a mirror (or palm). Smile. Say gently: 'Tu khaas hai.' Let the words soak into your being like sunlight.

gita: Gita (4.7): Whenever there is decline in dharma, I manifest Myself.
thought: Tumhara astitva kisi aur se chhota nahi hai.
practice: Place both hands on your shoulders. Give yourself a light hug. Whisper: 'Main mujhme poori hoon.' Stay there for 10 seconds.

gita: Gita (6.26): Wherever the mind wanders, bring it back to the Self.
thought: Vichaaron ka bazaar band karo, mann ka mandir kholo.
practice: Sit cross-legged. Breathe slowly. With each inhale, say 'Sa'; with each exhale, say 'Ham'. Repeat 5 times.

gita: Gita (6.5): Uddharet Atmanam — Lift yourself by your Self.
thought: Dukh ka arth hai—naya uday hone wala hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Close your eyes. Place your right hand over your heart. Breathe in gently. Say: 'Main hoon. Main kaafi hoon.' Stay with the warmth for a few moments.

whisper: Mera man mere paas vaapas aa raha hai.
practice: Put your phone away. Sit quietly and focus on the sound of your breath for 30 seconds. Whisper: 'Main vapas yahan hoon.'

gita: Gita (18.66): Sarva-dharmān parityajya — Surrender to Me, I’ll protect you.
thought: You are not a drop in the ocean; you are the ocean in a drop. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Look into a mirror (or palm). Smile. Say gently: 'Tu khaas hai.' Let the words soak into your being like sunlight.

gita: Gita (4.7): Whenever there is decline in dharma, I manifest Myself.
thought: Tumhara astitva kisi aur se chhota nahi hai.
practice: Place both hands on your shoulders. Give yourself a light hug. Whisper: 'Main mujhme poori hoon.' Stay there for 10 seconds.

gita: Gita (6.26): Wherever the mind wanders, bring it back to the Self.
thought: Vichaaron ka bazaar band karo, mann ka mandir kholo.
practice: Sit cross-legged. Breathe slowly. With each inhale, say 'Sa'; with each exhale, say 'Ham'. Repeat 5 times.

gita: Gita (6.5): Uddharet Atmanam — Lift yourself by your Self.
thought: Dukh ka arth hai—naya uday hone wala hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Close your eyes. Place your right hand over your heart. Breathe in gently. Say: 'Main hoon. Main kaafi hoon.' Stay with the warmth for a few moments.

gita: Gita (3.8): Karmaṇy evādhikāras te — Action is better than inaction.
thought: Energy follows action. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Stand up gently. Raise both arms over your head and inhale deeply. Stretch. Exhale while whispering: 'Chalu kar diya.' Now begin one small task.

gita: Gita (6.6): Bandhur ātmā — The mind can be a friend or enemy.
thought: Jo chinta karta hai, wo jeevan ka samay barbad karta hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Rub your palms. Touch your forehead with warmth. Whisper softly: 'Mujhe apne man par vishwas hai.' Now let one thought dissolve with each exhale.

gita: Gita (2.63): Krodhat bhavati sammohah — Anger leads to delusion.
thought: Anger is like fire; the more you feed it, the more it burns you.
whisper: Main shant hoon, main samajhdar hoon.
practice: Breathe in for 4 counts, hold for 4, exhale for 4. Repeat three times. Place a cool palm on your neck and feel calm return.

gita: Gita (2.60): Indriyani pramathini — Senses drag the mind easily.

practice: Sit cross-legged. Breathe slowly. With each inhale, say 'Sa'; with each exhale, say 'Ham'. Repeat 5 times.

gita: Gita (6.5): Uddharet Atmanam — Lift yourself by your Self.
thought: Dukh ka arth hai—naya uday hone wala hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Close your eyes. Place your right hand over your heart. Breathe in gently. Say: 'Main hoon. Main kaafi hoon.' Stay with the warmth for a few moments.

gita: Gita (3.8): Karmaṇy evādhikāras te — Action is better than inaction.
thought: Energy follows action. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Stand up gently. Raise both arms over your head and inhale deeply. Stretch. Exhale while whispering: 'Chalu kar diya.' Now begin one small task.

gita: Gita (6.6): Bandhur ātmā — The mind can be a friend or enemy.
thought: Jo chinta karta hai, wo jeevan ka samay barbad karta hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Rub your palms. Touch your forehead with warmth. Whisper softly: 'Mujhe apne man par vishwas hai.' Now let one thought dissolve with each exhale.

gita: Gita (2.63): Krodhat bhavati sammohah — Anger leads to delusion.
thought: Anger is like fire; the more you feed it, the more it burns you.
whisper: Main shant hoon, main samajhdar hoon.
practice: Breathe in for 4 counts, hold for 4, exhale for 4. Repeat three times. Place a cool palm on your neck and feel calm return.

gita: Gita (2.60): Indriyani pramathini — Senses drag the mind easily.
thought: Jahaan dhyan hai, wahi jeevan hai.
whisper: Mera man mere paas vaapas aa raha hai.
practice: Put your phone away. Sit quietly and focus on the sound of your breath for 30 seconds. Whisper: 'Main vapas yahan hoon.'

gita: Gita (18.66): Sarva-dharmān parityajya — Surrender to Me, I’ll protect you.
thought: You are not a drop in the ocean; you are the ocean in a drop. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Look into a mirror (or palm). Smile. Say gently: 'Tu khaas hai.' Let the words soak into your being like sunlight.

gita: Gita (4.7): Whenever there is decline in dharma, I manifest Myself.
thought: Tumhara astitva kisi aur se chhota nahi hai.
practice: Place both hands on your shoulders. Give yourself a light hug. Whisper: 'Main mujhme poori hoon.' Stay there for 10 seconds.

practice: Rub your palms. Touch your forehead with warmth. Whisper softly: 'Mujhe apne man par vishwas hai.' Now let one thought dissolve with each exhale.

gita: Gita (2.63): Krodhat bhavati sammohah — Anger leads to delusion.
thought: Anger is like fire; the more you feed it, the more it burns you.
whisper: Main shant hoon, main samajhdar hoon.
practice: Breathe in for 4 counts, hold for 4, exhale for 4. Repeat three times. Place a cool palm on your neck and feel calm return.

gita: Gita (2.60): Indriyani pramathini — Senses drag the mind easily.
thought: Jahaan dhyan hai, wahi jeevan hai.
whisper: Mera man mere paas vaapas aa raha hai.
practice: Put your phone away. Sit quietly and focus on the sound of your breath for 30 seconds. Whisper: 'Main vapas yahan hoon.'

gita: Gita (18.66): Sarva-dharmān parityajya — Surrender to Me, I’ll protect you.
thought: You are not a drop in the ocean; you are the ocean in a drop. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Look into a mirror (or palm). Smile. Say gently: 'Tu khaas hai.' Let the words soak into your being like sunlight.

gita: Gita (4.7): Whenever there is decline in dharma, I manifest Myself.
thought: Tumhara astitva kisi aur se chhota nahi hai.
practice: Place both hands on your shoulders. Give yourself a light hug. Whisper: 'Main mujhme poori hoon.' Stay there for 10 seconds.

gita: Gita (6.26): Wherever the mind wanders, bring it back to the Self.
thought: Vichaaron ka bazaar band karo, mann ka mandir kholo.
practice: Sit cross-legged. Breathe slowly. With each inhale, say 'Sa'; with each exhale, say 'Ham'. Repeat 5 times.

gita: Gita (6.5): Uddharet Atmanam — Lift yourself by your Self.
thought: Dukh ka arth hai—naya uday hone wala hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Close your eyes. Place your right hand over your heart. Breathe in gently. Say: 'Main hoon. Main kaafi hoon.' Stay with the warmth for a few moments.

gita: Gita (3.8): Karmaṇy evādhikāras te — Action is better than inaction.
thought: Energy follows action. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Stand up gently. Raise both arms over your head and inhale deeply. Stretch. Exhale while whispering: 'Chalu kar diya.' Now begin one small task.

thought: Dukh ka arth hai—naya uday hone wala hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Close your eyes. Place your right hand over your heart. Breathe in gently. Say: 'Main hoon. Main kaafi hoon.' Stay with the warmth for a few moments.

gita: Gita (3.8): Karmaṇy evādhikāras te — Action is better than inaction.
thought: Energy follows action. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Stand up gently. Raise both arms over your head and inhale deeply. Stretch. Exhale while whispering: 'Chalu kar diya.' Now begin one small task.

gita: Gita (6.6): Bandhur ātmā — The mind can be a friend or enemy.
thought: Jo chinta karta hai, wo jeevan ka samay barbad karta hai. – Pt. Shri Ram Sharma
practice: Rub your palms. Touch your forehead with warmth. Whisper softly: 'Mujhe apne man par vishwas hai.' Now let one thought dissolve with each exhale.

gita: Gita (2.63): Krodhat bhavati sammohah — Anger leads to delusion.
thought: Anger is like fire; the more you feed it, the more it burns you.
whisper: Main shant hoon, main samajhdar hoon.
practice: Breathe in for 4 counts, hold for 4, exhale for 4. Repeat three times. Place a cool palm on your neck and feel calm return.

gita: Gita (2.60): Indriyani pramathini — Senses drag the mind easily.
thought: Jahaan dhyan hai, wahi jeevan hai.
whisper: Mera man mere paas vaapas aa raha hai.
practice: Put your phone away. Sit quietly and focus on the sound of your breath for 30 seconds. Whisper: 'Main vapas yahan hoon.'

gita: Gita (18.66): Sarva-dharmān parityajya — Surrender to Me, I’ll protect you.
thought: You are not a drop in the ocean; you are the ocean in a drop. – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
practice: Look into a mirror (or palm). Smile. Say gently: 'Tu khaas hai.' Let the words soak into your being like sunlight.

gita: Gita (4.7): Whenever there is decline in dharma, I manifest Myself.
thought: Tumhara astitva kisi aur se chhota nahi hai.
practice: Place both hands on your shoulders. Give yourself a light hug. Whisper: 'Main mujhme poori hoon.' Stay there for 10 seconds.

gita: Gita (6.26): Wherever the mind wanders, bring it back to the Self.
thought: Vichaaron ka bazaar band karo, mann ka mandir kholo.
